alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:15PM EST until January 11 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of York County in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1111 PM EST, Rain gauges report rainfall totals of 2 to 3 inches in the area over the past 24 hours. Runoff from this recent heavy rainfall continues to produce flooding in the Wildcat Creek area of southeast York county, and flooding will likely continue through the overnight hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Hill and Newport. - Flooding is most likely along Wildcat Creek at Robertson Road southwest of Rock Hill. Flooding will likely impact Ogden Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
